column4: Update manager doesn't show 10.04.1. My 10.04 is up-to-date. How to upgrade?
It won't. If you have all the normal lucid-updates and lucid-security updates, you have 10.04.1
so 10.04.1 is just p√°ckaging? an up-to-date iso?
I thought my system monitor would show .1 up then
correct
try "lsb_release -a" in the terminal, it'll say 10.04.1 if you're fully updated
yeah, 10.04.1, thanks
the systemwide bash configuration file
doesn't serve as replacement for lost /root/.bashrc, right?
just use /etc/skel/.bashrc. They're not different in any way that matters.
ok checcking in natty, it seems root just removes an alert alias and comments some /etc/bash_completion related 'if'
I'm about to replace with one from another buddy which is just like I described. Thanks!
It doesn't really matter. If you want a suggestion anyway, owner root, group root, permissions 600
ok thanks
As I attempted to hint above, #ubuntu does not support unlocked root accounts or offer help with them. It appears you have one. Have fun with that.

I have no idea what is unlocked root accounts, I'm those idiots you know. Besides, I've never touched /root's permissions, so if something is wrong with them, it's because of bug[s] in upgrade processes
It doesn't matter, given that if /root can't be accessed by other, then nothing inside of /root can.
celthunder: that's why I want to touch only /root, being less intrusive, since everything under it will also be inaccessible as rww said
Ubuntu oneiric uses GNOME 3. Ubuntu 11.04's official repositories are sticking with GNOME 2, per our stable update policy.
what's unity exactly, a gnome 2 app, a gnome 2 patch, a gnome 2 fork?
Unity in 11.04 is a plugin for Compiz that provides a shell as an alternative to GNOME Panel, GNOME Shell, etc.
11.04 runs it on top of GNOME 2. Oneiric runs it on top of GNOME 3.
so it's a *compiz plugin*! and it just runs on top of gnome 2/3 as any regular gnome app. Ok, thanks for the info!
